text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

text: The wise man does not lay up his own treasures. The more he gives to others, the more he has for himself.
author: Lao Tzu

text: In seeking wisdom, the first step is silence, the second listening, the third remembering.
author: Solomon Ibn Gabirol

text: Wisdom is the reward you get for a lifetime of listening when you'd have preferred to talk.
author: Doug Larson

text: The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Do not be wise in words, be wise in deeds.
author: Jewish Proverb

text: The only real mistake is the one from which we learn nothing.
author: Henry Ford

text: Wisdom is not a product of schooling but of the lifelong attempt to acquire it.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Patience is the companion of wisdom.
author: Saint Augustine

text: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
author: Aristotle

text: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.
author: Plato

text: Wisdom is knowing what to do next; virtue is doing it.
author: David Starr Jordan

text: The greatest lesson in life is to know that even fools are right sometimes.
author: Winston S. Churchill
